bibl.title: Answer of Orvin Davis
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the original.

org.orgName: United States. Circuit Court (District of Columbia)

revisionDesc.change: added xml:ids; changed defendant Irvine to Orvin and deleted Orvin

div2.p: And the Orvin Davis comes into Court here in his own proper person and prays judgment of the Court upon the said write issued in this cause because he says that the said writ was served upon this defendant whose name is Orvin and not Irvine, and that he supposes the same was intended for to mean this deponent although he was baptized by the name of Orvin and not Irvine (to wit at the County of Washington in the District of Columbia( and by that name is called and known, and by the same name from the time of his baptism hitherto both been named and called: without this that he the said Orvin Davis now is or ever was called or known by the name of Irvine Davis as by the said write is above supposed. And this he is ready to verify wherefore he saith that the said Court here ought not to take nor will take cognizance of the said plea against him in this Court.
Orvin Davis being duly sworn deposes and says that the facts in the foregoing plea set forth and contained are true as therein set forth
Sworn to in Open Court 24th March 1835
Plea in abat offend by Deft this 25th of March 1835.
